etymology.description: Pictogram: a figure with two lines 二 for a head (one connected to the body, one above it), emphasizing the head.
etymology.interpretation: Depicts a human figure with an emphasized head, conveying the idea of the foremost or primary part. From this sense came meanings like “origin,” “first,” and later its use as the name of a currency unit.

examples.chinese: 这杯咖啡要二十元(這杯咖啡要二十元)。
examples.pinyin: Zhè bēi kāfēi yào èrshí yuán.
examples.english: This cup of coffee costs twenty yuan.

examples.chinese: 新王朝的元年开始推行新法(新王朝的元年開始推行新法)。
examples.pinyin: Xīn wángcháo de yuánnián kāishǐ tuīxíng xīnfǎ.
examples.english: In the first year of the new dynasty, new laws were implemented.

examples.chinese: 元旦我们放假(元旦我們放假)。
examples.english: We have a holiday on New Year’s Day.
